answerText: special relativity [accept relativistic effects; do not accept or prompt on "general relativity"][10] Relativistic effects explain some amount of the "contraction" experienced by this series of 15 metallic elements that sit above the actinides on the periodic table.
heading: MUT |2015 | 6 | 8 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The first person to consider the application of this theory to quantum chemistry was Bertha Swirles. [10] Name this theory that explains why gold has a golden color rather than silvery like most other metals; because the 1s electrons in gold travel 58% the speed of light, this theory is implicated.
